FacilityName: Maple Leaf Farms, Serenade Foods Division

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Maple Leaf Farms, Serenade Foods Division is a further processor of poultry products. We continuously strive to assure that our workers, neighbors and the environment are safe.
Maple Leaf Farms, Inc. has developed a Crisis Management Team to prepare for any emergency which may occur at any of the Maple Leaf Farms facilities.  Maple Leaf Farms Inc. is committed to protect their employees and the people of the surrounding community.
Currently, we have just completed a process hazard analysis.  The Maple Leaf Farms, Inc. Executive Board is committed to making our facilities the safest plants in Indiana.
The only regulated chemical used by Maple Leaf Farms is anhydrous ammonia used in the refrigeration system.  There is approximately 21,000 lbs of ammonia within the system. At most times the system charge is somewhat lower than this number.
As a part of our prevention plan we have performed a worst case and alternate release scenario centered around the possibility of an ammonia release. Our worst case scenario centers around the possibility of an ammonia release from our receiver during a pump down situation. Our alternate release scenario is centered around a piping release on the roof.
Maple Leaf Farms, Serenade Foods Division has in place a Process Safety Management / Risk Program.  As a result of the PSM / RMP Program the following procedures and policies are in place:
     Employee Participation Guidelines
     Employee Training
     Contractor Qualification Guidelines
     Pre-Startup Procedures
     Mechanical Integrity Inspection Policy
     Support Personnel Entry Program
     Hot Work Permit Program
     Management of Change Program
     Incident Investigation Program
     Emergency Planning and Response Plan
     Compliance Audit Procedure done by outside contractor
     Dissemination/Trade Secrets Policy
     Policy for Opening the Refrigeration System
     Process Hazard Analysis
Mechanical Integrity inspections are done annually to ensure the equipment is

operating properly.  Any problems are addressed and repaired as needed.
DESCRIPTION OF THE REFRIGERATION SYSTEM

Maple Leaf Farms-Serenade Division, Milford, Indiana is a poultry based processing and distribution facility. The facility incorporates a standard evaporation and compression closed loop ammonia refrigeration system. The system is installed to operate as a two-temperature single stage system. The compressors are split as High Stage and Low Stage Compressors. There exists, two different levels of saturated suction temperatures. Each level of suction temperature services a specific area of the plant.


SUMMARY OF THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Maple Leaf Farms Serenade Foods Division has not had a release in excess of 100 lbs of ammonia in the last five years.
DESCRIPTION OF THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

Warsaw HAZMAT Team is our primary response in the event of a catastrophic release or a release at night or on weekends.  They have toured our facilities and given us a hazard analysis.  We will be having drills twice yearly to familiarize the team with the equipment and procedures to be followed.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Because of executive support Maple Leaf Farms Serenade Foods Division maintains a comprehensive PSM program. This support allows our PSM / RMP team to have the freedom to make necessary improvements as they are identified.
Maple Leaf Farms Serenade Foods Division provides certification training opportunities for employees directly and indirectly involved with the ammonia refrigeration system through courses offered  by 3rd party consultants. This provides a better understanding of the operation of our ammonia refrigeration system allowing for safe operation of the system.
